questions.question: What condition promotes the growth of bacteria?

choices.answer: food with a pH that is highly alkaline

questions.question: Which responsibility is included in the Food and Drug Administration's role?

choices.answer: issuing licenses, permits, and sanitation scores
issuing a Food Code which is used by local agencies to regulate foodservice
approving food service HACCP plans for restaurants

questions.question: Which demonstrates the proper storage order for food in a refrigerator from top to bottom?

choices.answer: poultry, ground meat, whole cuts of meat, seafood, ready-to-eat food
ready-to-eat food, seafood, whole cuts of meat, ground meat, poultry
ready-to-eat food, poultry, seafood, whole cuts of meat, ground meat
ready-to-eat food, seafood, whole cuts of meat, poultry, ground meat

questions.question: How should chemicals be stored?
If an order of vacuum-packaged, sliced turkey meat is delivered at 49  F, the meat should be:

choices.answer: used for only cooked food preparation.

questions.question: Which is most likely to be a source of Hepatitis A virus?
What should staff do when receiving a delivery of food and supplies?

choices.answer: touch the food items to gauge temperatures and store
store food items immediately and then inspect within 6 hours
visually inspect all food items and stack in the receiving area
visually inspect all food items & check to make sure at the correct temp.

questions.question: Which procedure is acceptable when checking the internal temperature of food?

choices.answer: Take one recording of the temperature at the same location.
Check the temperature in the thickest part of the food.
Take at least two recordings of the temperature at the same location

questions.question: When can raw, unpackaged meat be offered for self-service?

choices.answer: food stands, where customers can take home the meat
when the meat meets strict requirements
when the meat is high quality
at restaurants where it will be cooked and eaten immediately

questions.question: A food handler has cooled a container of chili to 70°F  in 2 hours. How much time is left to cool to 41°

What must food handlers do when handling ready-to-eat food?
What temperature must stuffed salmon be cooked to
What is the minimum internal cooking temperature for a pork chop
Which guideline for re-serving food is a safe practice?

choices.answer: Food handlers may re-serve uncovered condiments to other customers.
Food handlers may re-serve uneaten bread to other customers.
Food handlers may re-serve unopened, prepackaged food in good condition.
Food handlers may re-serve plate garnishes to another customer.

questions.question: Ready-to-eat TCS food prepped in-house must be date marked if it is held for more than how many hours?
When holding food in hot-holding equipment, how often should the temperature be checked
What is the correct temperature to display sliced deli meat
Which is an unsafe method for cooling large amounts of hot food
Which procedure must be followed when transporting food for off-site service

choices.answer: Clean the inside of delivery vehicles yearly.
Assume the service site has safe water and garbage containers
Pack food in insulated food-grade containers
Store raw meat, poultry, and seafood and ready-to-eat items together

questions.question: What is the minimum internal temperature hot food must be held at to prevent pathogens from growing
In order for ground turkey to be safe, it should be cooked to what temperature for fifteen seconds
